Reviews.Title: “Great view but noisy location”
Reviews.Author: Yorkielvr
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a balcony bay view room. The view from the room was great! However, the room itself was not very large and the bathroom is small with minimal storage space. The rooms overlooking the bay hear alot of noise from the traffic on the main street in front of it, people at the pool, and the many trucks pulling into the Fresh Market. The pool was nice, but no hot tub. The location is excellent for sailing events at Shake-a-Leg, with Monty's Raw Bar, The Chart House and the Fresh Market all very close by. Parking is excessive and a car really isn't needed once you get to the hotel. Downtown Coconut Grove restaurants and the CocoWalk are easily within walking distance of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Some Good, Some Not So Good”
Reviews.Author: wintersummer
Reviews.Content: This is a hard review to write because we were very pleased with some aspects of our stay - but less than pleased with other parts. First, what we liked: Location is great, very close to many restaurants in Coconut Grove. There's a Fresh Market right across the street. We were upgraded to a suite (but, I think many of the rooms are suite-like) and it was an enormous space. Living room, dining room, bedroom, with room to spare. We were on a high floor, with great view of ocean. Service was great. We had a light evening meal at the Bistro Cafe in the lobby and it was good - with awesome service. There were some less-than-optimal parts to our stay. Parking is $20 a day - pretty expensive for a Courtyard. I gave the room high marks for space. The room gets lower marks for other things. For instance, the bathroom was tiny! I mean it might have been the smallest hotel bathroom I've ever seen in my travels. Door to the bathroom had paint peeling. Door to bathroom also ended about 2 inches above floor - meaning, you could slide your hand under the door. Very strange. Our room had a connecting door to another room. One lock worked...the flip type lock had screw missing and was loose. One more issue with bath - we could hear the entire conversation in the room next to us (while in our room's little tiny bath). I was worried the sound would keep us up, but it didn't. Would we stay here again? We just don't know. It wasn't bad, but it certainly wasn't the best place we've ever stayed.

Reviews.Title: “A Really Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OhioPassinthru
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here during late February on our way down to the Keys. The upper floors provide spectacular views of Biscayne Bay and the Marina across the street. A little pricey (it IS Coconut Grove for pete's sake) priced fairly for the area. Staff was friendly and responsive, room was spacious, modern and clean. Much has been said in other reviews about the comparatively small size of the bathroom but I found it to be fine. Perhaps an extra shelf for personal items would be a plus but I found it to be fine. My wife and I enjoyed the breakfast outside and I have to say that the eggs were some of the best-prepared I've ever had...I wouldn't expect that from a small kitchen like theirs. A typical excellent Marriott experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: torobuque
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located across from Diner Key and close to the Coconut Grove Sailing Club. There is a Fresh Market across the street, the Chart House and Montes are just a short walk. There is excellent public transportation to downtown Miami and to downtown Coconut Grove. Corner rooms are small but pleasant with nice views and a great balcony. Beware, however, if there is an event the room prices go sky high and they charge for valet parking and do not mention any public parking. Nice pool. I do not believe there is a hot tub. Good coffee in the morning. Pleasant business center but Internet seemed slow.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay, great location”
Reviews.Author: dennise_11
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from 4 nights at this hotel. I went alone for a bit of a rest and some sun and warmth (I am from the north!). Staff were friendly and professional. Location was excellent. My balcony overlooked the pool and across to the marina and Biscayne Bay. Despite no formal restaurant, there was a breakfast with excellent choice and Starbucks coffee; and good light fare in the evening (excellent with a glass of wine). The area is safe and good for walking with the Cocowalk mall (with its easy restaurants, outside seating, shops and cinemas) only 12 minutes away. A wonderful location for singles, business folks, families. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dsegers1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last weekend for a wedding. The hotel staff was very attentive and upgraded us to a room with a view of the bay. We had a lovely balcony where we could sit and watch the pool activities. The room was large and comfortable. All in all, this was a great place to stay, within walking distance to many restaurants and stores.

Reviews.Title: “Coconut Grove for Business”
Reviews.Author: CaboFishingDuo
Reviews.Content: This Marriott is in par with other Courtyards. Miss the buffet breakfast when the breakfast bar line is a 20 minute wait and this hotel does not offer room service. Room was clean and comforable, okay view with partial view of Biscayne Bay. Close to shopping with a 10 minute walk and just a stone's throw to the marina. Stop by the Fresh Market for some great natural snacks. Only downside was noisy air conditioner fan that seemed to rattle.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: ShayB27
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend the night before leaving on a cruise. It was in a nice location: walking distance to Coco Walk, which has a lot of great shops and restaurants, and an easy ride both from the airport and to the Port of Miami. The hotel itself was quite nice, it offered a lovely pool and cafe. The room was well kept, clean and comfortable. I was able to book it via Priceline for $80. Parking was valet, with a $20 fee, breakfast was a bit pricey and not included.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to invest in new mattresses!”
Reviews.Author: Bahamas242
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Courtyard Miami for a sailing regatta this past week. The rooms were nicely appointed and the balconies were very spacious. However, the rooms were not sound proof, and someone was having a party on the floor above which was really loud. You could also hear people talking in other rooms when you stood in the bathroom! The entrance of the hotel is up several steps and the hotel does not have automatic doors, which made coming and going with lots of bags a problem if the valet was not available to get the door. There was a wheelchair ramp off to the side. The parking was very expensive; soemthing like $26 for 24 hours. Street parking was available but required feeding meters. There is a fresh market accross the street and a refrigerator in the room which was helpful with feeding hungry youth sailors. The water was very hot, but easily adjusted, and the water pressure was fantastic. We had two rooms, and both of the rooms had lock problems. The locks are battery operated and had multiple failures while we were there, requiring long waits for the mechanic to fix the lock and provide new keys. My biggest complaint however was the quality of the mattresses. I have stayed at many courtyards, and I have never had such a terrible mattress. They had absolutely no support, and I had to continuously fight the feeling of rolling into the middle of the bed. My daughter and I shared a bed, and we both weigh about 120 lbs., so I do not think our weight was the problem! The microwave in the shop was not working, so you could not warm up microwavable food purchased in the shop after hours. We ate breakfast at the cafe one morning, and the food was good and the prices were reasonable. We would stay at this hotel again as it was very convenient for the regatta, but I do hope they upgrade the mattresses before then! I know this hotel was recently changed from a Doubletree to a courtyard, so maybe they have not finished upgrading.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of fraud.”
Reviews.Author: Chris D
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the courtyard Marriott coconut grove (Nov. 26-28, 2011) before I left for a Caribbean cruise. It was terrible! I checked out on the 28th and their shuttle drove us to the port. Upon my return to the U.S. a week later I received a billing statement saying I owed $684 for the 5 nights I stayed plus room service, beer, telephone calls, and a gift card. But I only stayed 2 nights and was out of the country for the other 3 days!!!! When I called the hotel they told me I needed to talk to the assistant G.M... After 2 days of trying to get ahold of him he told me he would "investigate" and call me back that day... 2 days went by with no response so I called back and left a message, again and again and again... It has now been a month and he has not called me back or contacted me in any way!!! Also one of the other ppl I was staying with received a letter from American express asking about a duplicate card request from the card he used at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot for business in Miami!”
Reviews.Author: Bizyman
Reviews.Content: This property is immediately across the street from the marina in Coconut Grove. Many of the rooms feature spacious decks that look out over the water and have fantastic views. I enjoyed sitting on the deck with my laptop at night finishing up my work for the day... The staff was very pleasant and courteous. I prefer Coconut Grove to the beach locations North of the city for business trips. It's very pleasant and safe. Beautiful. Doesn't have the beach grime or party scene feel to it. There are also a ton of great places to eat in the town center and it is a short 10 minute walk from the hotel to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience overall...”
Reviews.Author: jelsrtrav
Reviews.Content: The view was outstanding and the corner balcony suite was a steal...a well-equipped gym, but they need to keep the hand sanitizer stocked...great linens and bedding...acceptable food in the cafe...my complaints were addressed promptly and without resistance....

Reviews.Title: “a reasonable 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: sbercher
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at this hotel at the start of our Florida vacation for 1 night. The rate was excellent at 82 euros for a double room. The agent at checkin was pleasant and helpful. She was new and had to call her manager a couple of times but she was apologetic about it and very pleasant throughout. We had a room on the 6th floor with a view of the bay and the swimming pool. The room was a bit on the small size but had a balcony and was very clean, if a little outdated. I loved the topper on the bed which was very comfortable. The bathroom was small but sufficient for 2 people, and was clean. We used the pool and it was also very clean with free towels and chairs provided. The location is good, within a 15-minutes walk to Coco Walk. I would not hesitate to come back if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: tropicalia
Reviews.Content: PROS: This hotel has a great location in Coconut Grove; expedient valet parking and gracious staff. A lovely pool area invites relaxation. CONS: The bathroom lacks shelves to put your toiletries. Rooms need a safe. There are safes available behind the front desk. They give you a key with the safeâ€™s number on it. When you ask for your valuables, they do not ask for an ID nor signature. Nothing. I told the employees that they must ask for ID's and they looked at me like I was from Mars. If anyone finds your safe key, they are welcome to your possessions. Also no private area to withdraw your tiara from the safe. Another problem is the lack of a restaurant or coffee shop on premises. There is a Starbuckâ€™s counter area with some salads, muffins, bagels, sandwiches etc, but they are closed from 10:00 to 11:00 am and early in the PM. Fresh Market across the street has a wonderful bakery and prepared foods, but no coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Great view!”
Reviews.Author: michaelmle
Reviews.Content: Room 912. We stayed at the Courtyard Marriott in Coconut Grove for one night and was very impressed. It was a quick check in and staff was super friendly. Alexis checked us in and told us about the local area since this was our first time in Miami. We were informed about the area around Cocowalk. Lobby was very open and welcoming. The business center, pool, snack shop, cafe were all located in the lobby area. We were assigned room 916 with bay view and balcony. What a room! Small but very clean. We had a view of the bay and the pool. Watched the sunrised from our balcony was amazing. We were very impressed how clean the room was. Spotless and the sheets were super white! The gym was adequate and had the necessary equipments for a good workout. Equipments were cleaned and organized with plenty of clean fresh towels. Pool area was great! But come early to reserve the tents if you burn easily! Very limited on shady areas if you are trying to avoid the sun. Pros: clean, friendly staff, great attractions within walking distance, relaxing, and great Internet deals for weekend trips! Our room was only $99 with breakfast for two Cons: parking ($25), limited street parking, and that's it!

Reviews.Title: “What A Find!!”
Reviews.Author: WD80
Reviews.Content: We were invited to surprise birthday party as well as an informal gathering of friends this weekend. Both events were in Coconut Grove and we lived near Homestead Fl., almost 1 hour away. On the day of the event, we booked the Courtyard at a great rate through the Marriotts' website. We arrived in the early afternoon to check in and the lady at the counter was very helpful. We were given a room with a view of the bay. It was a beautiful location along Bayshore Drive which is a lush tropical section in the Grove. The hotel is directly across the street from Fresh Market, so we walked over and got some wine and snacks for later in the evening. Our room reservation included breakfast which was made to order. Valet parking is almost $25.00 a night, but fortunately for us, we were able to park on the street for a couple of hours until after midnight till 9:00 am when parking tickets are not issued. We particularly liked the coziness of the room as well as the balcony view of the bay. The hotel has a large outdoor pool which we tried early the next day. We decided to get a late checkout until 2:00 pm to enjoy the pool, the room, and the quiet as long as possible. We have lived in the Miami area for years and did not know about this hotel. It was a great find.

Reviews.Title: “Miami 2011 - Coconut Grove”
Reviews.Author: Thstarling
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this location from 7/21 - 7/24, nice lobby area small convenience store located behind check-in counter(asprin, soda, chipts,etc.) Also an area for travelers completed with approx 8-10 pc stations with internet access for you to use. The new lobby kiosk & newly designed breakfast bar area was nice. The only real issue I had with this location which unfortunately is becoming more of the norm for several of their properties is that there is limited parking near this location. There is a parking deck beneath the building but it is only for valet parking which is $20/per night. The location is excellent central to most Miami attractions & locations. Several great restaurants and shopping areas nearby, CocoWalk 5 minute walk away & Kennedy Park across the street near marina. Fifteen minutes from downtown Bayside Marketplace, about a 20 minute drive from South Beach, US-1 to the A1A, 30 minutes from Aventura Mall. When we checked in was told we were being upgraded to a suite, it appears all of the rooms may be suites you can see on the sign at top of building that this was formerly a DoubleTree Hotel, room was spacious, king sized bed in my suite 1601, refrigerator no microwave. However if you don't mind going to the lobby area there is a microwave you can use there . Flat screen tv's in both the bedroom & "living room" area only showing local basic cable tv programming, HBO/ESPN. The bathroom is tiny, shower & toilet which is more than enough in most cases but by far smallest bathroom I've ever seen in a commercial property hotel but hey I was clean when I left the bathroom so thats all that matters.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Average”
Reviews.Author: Hnjammal
Reviews.Content: We stayed that overnight with 2 kids. The room was ok. Nothing special and very standard. The bathroom was ok as well. The pool was nice especially for the kids. Overall the location was great especially being a relatively close walk to Cocowalk which was nice. The location was pretty central which was something great. But recommended to drive around since we didnt notice any public transportation around. The thing I didnt like about the hotel was the service. We called the reception twice for advise on what to do while we were in miami and they sounded a bit annoyed. I didnt appreciate that. In the end it was the valet that actually gave us proper advise.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely modern comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: matlin_9
Reviews.Content: When we arrived I was surprised how nice the lobby was, plus free internet and laptops for guests to use. We got a lovely room with a balcony on the 11th floor. I was very pleased. It was spacious, with a comfortable bed, large flat screen tv, and a view of the city. The room was also very clean. My husband really enjoyed the pool, and the gym. The hotel is in walking distance to shopping and restaurants in the center of Coconut Grove, It is about a 12 minute walk. Across the street is a really nice upscale market. The only problem was parking. The hotel charged $24 a day, so across the street one block south you can park for $20 overnight.THen we discovered that after 12am you can park free on the street till 10am. Meter parking is $1.50 an hour all over Coconut Grove. The hotel was really nice, it is a small hotel, but I would highly recommend it. No restaurant on premises, just a small coffe shop.

Reviews.Title: “Horrific. Outdated. Filthy. Obnoxious Staff.”
Reviews.Author: DiverJim_02
Reviews.Content: Things were off to a bad start when I given a tiny room and no air conditioning and the front desk refused to change the room, stating that the hotel was full. I did not believe that the hotel was full because I got it for more than 50% the rack rate through Priceline.com, if it's full why are they selling it for more than 50% off? The next morning the card reader on my door stopped functioning. I asked at the desk for a new card as I thought my card was somehow deprogrammed, but it did not work. Another trip to the front desk. I got a third card and this too did not. The front desk person they told me that I must have some kind of metal in my pocket that is demagnetizing the card, and it was my fault. I had gone outside to feed the meter and told this to the desk person and said that instead of feeding the meter, I should have gone to a 'blue box' and bought a parking ticket to place in my car. However, there were no 'blue boxes' in the area, just meters, but I believe he was just being condescending, not trying to be helpful. Oh yeah, there were a trashcan full of vomit covered towels on the table directly outside the elevators on my floor, so I had to walk past said trash can SIX times while working out the key card fiasco, which was caused by the card reader affixed to my door having a malfunction (not something magnetic in my pocket). There were also vomit covered towels piled into the ash tray near the valet room, and the front desk said they did not remove the towels because no one told them about it. They're saying that the valets, 5 feet away from the towels, didn't notice it? And the person walking the front desk missed someone walking through the lobby covered in vomit?!

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate-clean- great location”
Reviews.Author: patoNyc
Reviews.Content: I searched high and low for an affordable- clean- modern hotel near south beach. This was fantastic value. This Marriott is only two years old. The lobby is designed for business travelers and leisure nicely. In the lobby: large screen TV's modern furnishings snack concession WITH STARBUCKS COFFEEE indoor outdoor seating. Just wonderful. A 'Whole Foods' type market is right across the street with sweeping views of the marina. The Ritz Carlton is around the corner also if you'd like to grab a cocktail. Local bus service runs right by to the Cocowalk for a quarter!! yep 25 cents. Perfect for a short stay- We flew into Miami Intrnl. and stayed there to meet a cruise. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat. Happy Travels-

Reviews.Title: “Great stop off on our way to the Keys”
Reviews.Author: Sborgia
Reviews.Content: This property exceeded my expectations! Even though I am a Marriott employee I have a more discerning eye for all of our brands. This Courtyard operated like a full service Marriott. The valet was an added bonus too. They couldn't have been more helpful and they were of "Ritz Carlton" quality. One valet ran to our car to get us our gatorades in the cooler after a hot run in the morning and the valet on duty the night before helped us pick a very authentic and delicious cuban restaurant! The bathrooms were a bit small and my 6 foot husband had a hard time in the shower but again it was very pursposeful and a great value for our trip. I would definitely stay here again and recommend to others!

Reviews.Title: “Simple but decent lodging, a good value for the area”
Reviews.Author: hibiyaparker
Reviews.Content: On check-in Gold status got us upgraded to a 1-bedroom suite with a sweeping view of downtown Miami and Coral Gables. The free wi-fi works like a charm. Dining options are limited to the bistro downstairs, which has a decent and reasonably priced selection... but no room service. The outdoor pool is reasonably sized although there are streets on two sides of it which give it a hectic atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: shai22
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, not too far from south beach and close to shops. I thought the renovations were done well. The staff were helpful and friendly. They also provide not only a free open business area with printer, but the Internet is also free in your room. Parking is $24 (including tax) but the staff offered me tips to get around paying for parking at the hotel or on the street. The pool area is amazing; I could of spent the entire day there. Great coffee downstairs as well.

Reviews.Title: “good value but roomws need to be painted or walls need to be cleaned”
Reviews.Author: RobinArlington
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was a great value for what we paid ($119 per night with AAA in the first week of December). Yes, it is a drag to have no other option for parking other than valet especially since this a Courtyard and not the Ritz. That being said, the valet staff was great. Also Javier who was at front desk one day and manned the cafe the next was terrific--friendly and professional. The valet had brought my luggage to the front desk and by the time I had gotten my ticket and walked myself to the front desk - Javier already had me checked in my looking at my luggage tag. Nice touch. The Location is great with a wonderful Fresh Market across the street. However all this does not excuse dirty walls in the rooms and the bathrooms. They need a good scrubbing and/or repainting. That was a big downside to me and prevented it from kept it from being a truly prefect visit.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money”
Reviews.Author: airie2011
Reviews.Content: The hotel charges 20.00 a day for parking also when we checked out we were charged bogus room taxes of about 60.00. Rooms are cramped and out dated.There was no ocean view from our room and the courtyard view was lackluster. Location to Cocowalk and parks is with in walking distance which is the ONLY reason it would be worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlfieRT
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Marriott's Hotels before, I love their beds and pillows, and this is no exception. Great location, just a few block from CocoWalk.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't live up to "Marriott" brand”
Reviews.Author: anteayer
Reviews.Content: I just checked in today actually and am very dissappointed. My previous experiences with Marriott (whether Courtyard or otherwise) have always been good. Until now. I came into the room and noticed that the basic structure of the building are dirty. The walls need a new coat of paint and the carpet is stained. The bathroom light makes a loud buzzing noise. The walls are super thin and I can hear everything that is going on in the rooms around me. The TV doesn't have a good volume - it's either too soft or too loud. In addition, the free wi-fi is extremely slow. I would rather pay for a faster one. There also no room service or hotel restaurant, so I needed to take a cab to dinner. (There is however a cafe with snacks and sandwiches). I do have a balcony, but the light is out, so it's very dark at night. For the price I am paying - $189 a night, I expect a nicer hotel. The plus sides are that the Marriott corporation has made sure the sheets and beds are up to standard, and are exactly what I expected. Also, the staff is super friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: tbueno
Reviews.Content: Great location especially if you are a runner! Very safe and convenient! The only negative was having to valet park and not having any other parking option.

Reviews.Title: “Super Comfy Beds”
Reviews.Author: James-Laynie
Reviews.Content: Purpose of Trip: Weekend getaway from Orlando, life, and responsibilities > To shop and play. We had a hard time finding the hotel for some reason. Oddly and disappointedly GOOGLE Maps took me to the JW Marriott downtown. Then, the staff lead me to another Courtyard Marriott, just over the draw bridge. Luckily, third time was a charm and we got to the right hotel after driving in from Orlando, FL. The staff was nice. Check-in was speedy with no problems. We weren't high maintenance in any way - so we don't know how long it might have taken if we asked for extra towels. We stayed in 506. Really, we were there just to sleep so for the purpose of our hotel - it served GREATLY! I have to say, I've taken many leisurely vacations - this was my FAVORITE bed to sleep in. The hair dryer sounded like it would start a fire. (Good thing I brought my own). The water pressure in the shower was strong; it was very nice. Free Wi-Fi in our room was a DEFINITE plus since we had to look up driving directions, what to do, and of course to check in our friends and families via E-mail and Facebook. ;) The hotel is close to CocoWalk and shops. Definitely walkable. Other shopping was VERY close by. Everything was on US-1. Shops at Sunset, Dadeland Mall, The Falls, The Villages of Merrick...A LOT of great SHOPPING in a matter of blocks!!! This was a great place to stay for a weekend getaway with girlfriends for shopping. We even made the 40-minute drive to the Coopertown Airboat Tours. Must-Do, even for a native Floridian such as I. See my review!

Reviews.Title: “A bit disorganized”
Reviews.Author: prudenttrav
Reviews.Content: I stayed at CMCG with a spouse and a toddler for 6 days in early April. About 2 months in advance we reqested a crib and a bay view. When we arrived, we received only a partial bay view (room 808) and were informed that the staff couldn't find a crib for us. We made it clear that there are serious safety issues with our child not sleeping in a crib and suggested the staff to contact other hotels to find one. We had the crib by the evening but we felt as if we had to work to get it. Upon arrival, we requested a frigde and a microwave and got a fridge the next day and never saw a microwave. So much for special requests. If you want a full bay view, I suggest you request a pool and bay view. The hotel location is rather good. It's about 8-10 km from downtown Miami. A short 5-7min walk would take you to the Coconut Grove Village. It is located in good residential district. Across the street from the hotel you will find Fresh Market store, where you can purchase fresh produce, cheese and deli meats, wine, beer, baked goods and some ready made meals. There are also few restaurants (Monty's, Scotty's, Chart House) in 300m range that offer dining with bay views. Housekeeping in this hotel is excellent. I'd say the maid was going above and beyond to make sure our room was clean and pleasant to stay in. By far, the highlight of this hotel. Rooms are small but adequate. The bathroom felt even smaller. Rooms are not renovated and they have no flat TVs. The hotel's directory is not available and instead you are given a sheet with basic info (if you of course ask for it at the reception). As per the receptionist's statement, the hotel is yet to be renovated. The pool is nice and of decent size. The water could be warmer. The hotel provides towels. Hotel's wireless internet is slow but very reliable and quite easy to set up. Breakfast and snacks are available at the hotel for extra charge. Breakfast would cost you at least ten dollars per person. There's also a paid valet parking which you'd have to take if you're bringing a car because on-street parking is paid 24/7. Would I give them a second chance? Perhaps. That would depend on them honouring special requests and offering free breakfast and/or free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Location: This is a missable spot”
Reviews.Author: moorpheus
Reviews.Content: Bad location. Mediocre Rooms. Good Staff. Cabs everywhere! WiFi Courtyard Marriott has mediocre although clean rooms, requires cabs to go anywhere, and has excellent staff. For me, the location is a deal breaker . The room is small, adequate, clean. The electric plugs are on the lamp base. WiFi is a PITA to get into (still unable to get wifi on my iTouch) and adequate but slow (and free which is a +). The bathroom is small with a sink (I like a counter) and is dark. TV is an old Phillips not a Flat Screen. My room looks at tennis courts, and is above the truck entrance. Coconut Grove is a long walk ($5-7 cab drive for me) for restaurants, shopping or areas of interest. Good if you want to tire your kids, but it makes everything an effort.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel - great staff, very good location”
Reviews.Author: mooshai
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night for a quick business trip to the Miami/Coral Gables area. Centrally located for certain parts of the city, but a bit of a haul to South Beach - so if that's your destination stay closer. Plan on 15-20 minutes and $30-40 to take a cab to South Beach. However, given the price of the hotel (paid 124 plus tax etc.) the money saved paid for various transportation expenses. This hotel is located on the corner, across the street from the bay, in a semi-residential area - so quiet and peaceful. Very friendly staff, roomy balcony, and good sized room. My ONLY complaint was that the bathroom was VERY small with almost no counter space. All things considered, hard to take issue about that. Will definitely stay there again when in Miami and surrounding towns.

Reviews.Title: “comfy bed, nice balcony”
Reviews.Author: ronbonbfhon
Reviews.Content: We were looking for something affordable in this area, and found the Doubletree to be about 2/3 the price of others in the area. The huge king bed was super comfy, and there was a nice big balcony, not some tiny thing you would normaly expect in a hotel. The elevators were super fast. We did not use valet parking (hate it), but the meters are free out front during the night, and we only stayed one night. The WG Puck coffee in the room was lame, but they actually provide half and half creamers which I have never seen in any hotel room, a nice touch of class. We did not try the restaurant and the bar was expensive, but hey, it's coconut grove. The pool area is very nice looking, that was our view. It has a big deck, with a lot of canopy area on the sides, and a big bar. The lack of a hot tub at the pool is a bummer for those of us with sore spots.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal base in Coconut Grove”
Reviews.Author: MeggTravellers
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3nights whilst husband attended a conference at another hotel( and spent 1 night at Sofitel at Miami airport on this same trip). Though the hotel looks is a little dated on the outside the rooms were clean, spacious and nicely decorated. The staff were very friendly and keen to help, always greeted you by name. Ideally situated for a short ride to Miami downtown and the museums. Plenty of shopping near by whether around the corner in Coconut Grove or at Dadeland Mall. We had kids with us and they loved the free fresh baked cookies at the front desk! Parks near by to walk to and the beach. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, close to CocoWalk”
Reviews.Author: azogal
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family January 3-5, 2009 after checking out of the Doubletree Surfcomber on South Beach. We decided to split our trip just for a change of scenery. While South Beach is fun and lively, this hotel is more relaxing. The rooms were clean and we had no complaints about the hotel. The hotel is in a very residential area on a main street surrounded by apartments and condos and across the street from many marinas. The valet parking was very fast. We called from our room just before we walked out the door and we never had to wait for the car. The pool was not heated and pretty cold so if a heated pool is important this probably isn't the place for you. The pool area also could have used a few more chairs. I also don't think the pool area is staffed with waiters so not the place for you if you want waiters to bring you drinks while you sun bathe. The Fresh Market is across the street in the Marina. Monty's Raw Bar is a great place for Stone Crabs and is a 10-minute walk. The Mayfair and CocoWalk and the small, older business district are about a 10-minute walk away. Mayfair is almost completely empty, but the CocoWalk had some stores such as Gap and chain restaurants such as Cheesecake Factory, Hooters, and Chilli's. The surrounding streets had more non-chain restaurants and stores. The Sonesta Bay Resort is more conveniently located to this business area.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice Near Coconut Grove”
Reviews.Author: MobileResident
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this property for three nights. We chose this location to be near Coconut Grove which is about a 10 minute walk from the hotel. We stayed in a "bay view" room without a balcony that we thought was well worth the nominal added charge(about $10/day). We stayed on the non-smoking 12th floor with a nice unobstructed view of Biscayne Bay. The room was spacious, clean and fresh smelling. The beds were very comfortable and the furnishings were in good repair. The bathroom was well appointed but interestingly lacked a fan. There were two closets and ample storage drawers. The room was cleaned and serviced each day. Two issues that have previously been noted by prior guests($23/day valet parking fee & need to go to the lobby for ice) are indeed the case. We did not find the elevators to be "slow" as some have reported. We did not find the breakfast arrangements to be as poor as some have previously reported. We had free continental breakfasts as our Hilton HHonors option but when we found this did not include cereal we opted to pay an added $5/person fee(plus taxes and automatic gratuity charge) to get a full buffet breakfast including bacon,sausage,eggs,etc. The Fresh Market across the street is a great choice if you wish to opt for non-restaurant food options.

Reviews.Title: “Overall OK”
Reviews.Author: nsvlbimmerguy
Reviews.Content: In looking for a property to stay over the Memorial day weekend, we decided to stay a little outside of the beach area and chose Coconut Grove, which we had thought was a little more upscale than it appears to actually be. The hotel staff were very courteous, disposition of our car, and checkin went by smoothly. (If you're easily stressed by slow elevators, beware.) We had been promised a room with a view when the reservation was made, which we did not get, subsequent requests to move were met with rate increases, so we stayed put. The room was clean, but showing it's age, the carpet was worn in spots and the bath had paint peeling from the ceiling with the appearance of mold forming. On the plus side, the hotel is a few blocks from the main CG dining and entertainment area and there's several places across the street in the marina to dine, etc. The housekeeping, lobby and car porters were all very helpful. While the hotel proved a little further away than we realized, in traveling back and forth to the beach and other parts of the city, it was a very relaxing place to stay overall.

Reviews.Title: “Fun in the Sun”
Reviews.Author: Whenry
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the doubletree coconut grove for during a wed and thur night. The hotel Bay view is a great view for floors 8 and up. The weather was spectacular and the coconut grove area was somewhat quiet for the area. The hotel is located on bayshore drive across the street from a upscale grocery store. the rooms were not huge and have pedestal sinks, but the king bed was HUGE. The pool was very nice compared to the other places we stayed. Its actually 10ft deep and very welcoming. Stay away from the Valet Parking ($23 a night) and the breakfast ($30 for 2 people).. The walk to the local store area is about 10-12 blocks, so not super close walking, but it is a great place for food and shopping. The GreenStreet restaurant has AWESOME breakfast. Probably one of the better priced hotels for the area.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Sebastian_FLBillmar
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Doubletree Coconut Grove for two nights to attend a wedding in Miami. The location is very good and convenient to most Miami hot spots. The Coconut Grove area seems to be a dying area however and shops were closed and two restaurants indicated they were moving as business had been down. Across the street from the hotel is a grocery store which has everything you can imagine in the way of a gourmet grocery--it was fantastic. There were fresh veggies, pastries, wines and even pre made sandwiches and meals which looked fabulous. Most rooms at the hotel have a balcony and ours faced the bay but the balcony contained huge obstructions about 3 feet high. Beware of them. Only some rooms contain the balcony obstructions. On the balcony (we couldn't sit out there because if we were seated we would face the concrete wall obstruction) there was a nice breeze and the view was fabulous had it not been for the concrete obstructions. The rooms definitnely need updating but were comfortable. The bathroom is small and the shower head flows but a trickle. There is another sink in the bedroom portion of the room but no mirron above it! There is only one ice machine in the lobby area. There is valet parking only at $20 per day which is pricey if you are going to be going in and out and tipping the staff. Breakfast buffet was $15.95 per person and included coffee or juice--I don't know where the other reader got the $40 figure. There are other braekfast items offered for an average of $10. Last but not least there was a huge "palmetto" bug (roach) in my room on the last evening before we checked out. I reported it and was told sorry but there was no other accommodation suggested. Because we were checking out, I did not pursue the issue. All in all, if you are looking for an average type hotel which is priced average, this is the place. The staff were pleasant and the hotel appeared clean, but the roach was another story.

Reviews.Title: “$40.00 breakfast buffett”
Reviews.Author: lstei1948
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and clean,but needs updating.There is only one ice machine in the lobby,and none anywhere else. The valet parking gets expensivef you tip everytime you need your car.It is also too far from the port of miami if you are going on a cruise. And $40.00 for a buffett breakfast that is a comp at every oyher hotel i have stayed in was way out of line,I even had to pay for morning coffee!!

Reviews.Title: “Great quality for the price”
Reviews.Author: cabopc
Reviews.Content: This hotel has amazing views of the harbor and the rooms get a nice cross breeze. The service was excellent and the employees were very helpful. Itâ€™s a convenient location within easy walking distance of downtown Coconut Point and itâ€™s just across the street from Scottyâ€™s Landing a fun place to eat and drink. Our room was spacious and the room service fast and tasty. Valet parking is required.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the Doubletree”
Reviews.Author: mollyanne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree one night pre-cruise in February. Everyone seems to gravitate to the Port Area when they are crusing out of Miami but we wanted to try the Coconut Grove as we had read many nice reviews of this area. Cab from the airport was approx $30 - the hotel's website states it's 7 miles from the airport - but I'm not sure our driver took the most direct route... We arrived at the hotel about 12:30 and there were no rooms available so we stepped outside to the pool bar and had a drink and relaxed in the sun. The pool are was large and nice - the water itself felt pretty cold to the touch! We were able to check in within 45 minutes. We received a nice corner room on the 7th floor. Walked into a large area where there was a closet and also a large vanity area with coffee maker and sink. The coffeemaker/coffee was by Wolfgang Puck -the coffee was actually drinkable! The bedroom area was a little on the small side but very clean and nice. The bed was so comfortable and had nice linens and a duvet. Off the bedroom was a good sized balcony with table and 2 chairs. The bathroom was large and very clean. It also featured a huge tub - the longest I think I have ever seen! Bath amenities are by Neutrogena. We did not have dinner at the hotel but enjoyed a very good breakfast for $10 pp. The eggs came out steaming! They also have a breakfast buffet available We were at the port of Miami (by cab) in about 20 minutes time. The bell /valet staff were very friendly. The Coconut Grove area is very nice. We walked to Cocowalk and the Shops at Mayfair. Lots of shops and artwork. The Biscayne Bay is on the other side of street and we walked back through all the marinas, etc., and had a fantastic dinner at Monty's Raw Bar. I would definitely recommend this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “loved the bed and almost everything else!”
Reviews.Author: schalby
Reviews.Content: We ended up getting this hotel through priceline and I definitely feel like we got a great deal! We were just in Miami for a long layover/shopping trip and this fit our needs perfectly. The hotel has an amazingly comfortable bed and everything was extremely clean. This was our first stay in a Doubletree, and we appreciated the cookie and the Neutrogena products. The staff was helpful, though they weren't extraordinary. The valets were nice, but it was annoying to have to wait to get our rental car every time we needed it. We walked to the Coconut Grove shopping area and had a great meal at the Cheesecake Factory. We also bought food at the great gourmet market across the street. I would definitely stay here again, though unless I get another bargain like on Priceline, I probably won't!

Reviews.Title: “double tree hotel ,coconut grove”
Reviews.Author: toni1041
Reviews.Content: Stayed in coconut grove at the double tree hotel on xmas eve and it was great. The staff were very helpful and ensured we got a reservation that night for chart house restaraunt which was fab (even got free desserts) The hotel was clean and comfortable and view form bacony over marina kept hubby very happy. Went to coco walk and was impressed by how clean everything was. Would have no hesitation going back!

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for me!”
Reviews.Author: dawn_lyn
Reviews.Content: I stayed here Dec. 2-4 for a business trip. It was smaller than I expected, and I didn't particularly care for the food. It was a good location and a reasonable price. I liked the valet staff, they were fun! I'll be back next time I am in Miami for work.

Reviews.Title: “Wished we had stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: Bedientes
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for one night, Nov. 11. We live on the other coast of Florida and had just driven over to Miami for the night and to visit the Fairchild Botanic Gardens the next day. I admit that we don't usually stay at very nice hotels, as we usually watch out money, but we we celebrating our second anniversary so I decided to spend a little. I was not disappointed with my choice. The Doubletree seemed to be the cheapest choice in Coconut Grove proper, so the other hotels there might be nicer, but we really enjoyed our room. We got a premium bay view room which had one balcony facing Biscayne Bay and another balcony with chairs facing north, still with a view of the bay at one end. The weather was lovely while we were there, so we switched off the A/C and opened the doors to the balconies which made a really nice cross breeze. The bedroom and bathroom of the room were not very big, but it did have a nice large sitting area with TV, sofa , and a table and chairs for 4. The furniture all looked fairly up to date, and the bedding was nice. the bathroom looked like it had been redone at some point, because even thing looked very clean and taken care of. Check in and valet parking was very simple. We only stayed one night and only used the car when we left the next day, so we didn't deal too much with the valets. We didn't get to use the pool either. We ordered room service breakfast, and they were really fast. The prices weren't TOO outrageous all things considered and the food was good. I'm sure there are nicer hotels around, especially out on Miami Beach, but if you want to stay in the Coconut Grove area, it is a good choice. It is close to the Cocowalk area and has a great view of the bay.

Reviews.Title: “Okay stay at the doubletree”
Reviews.Author: tigerlillies14
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from Oct 20 to the 23 2007. Overall it was an okay hotel. I read the reviews before and pretty much agree with them. We won a package deal to stay at the doubletree and I do not think I would chose to stay here on my own The staff wasn't all the helpful when we checked in. Almost rude and when we asked about maps/attracts the front desk lady said they were all out of maps of coconut grove. One plus thing we got to check in early (we arrived at 11:30) We stayed in a city view with a balcony. The room was a bit small and seemed like it was squished together. The desk was at the end of the bed and you couldn't even pull out the chair. The bathroom was very small and I would pity anyone who was catastrophic. The bathroom amenities did not come with anything but shampoo and soap. I called down to housekeeping and ask for a shower cap/ more soap (since we only got one bar), some conditioner, and basic vanity kit. The housekeeping finally brought this two on our second night. Another problem with the bathroom is the shower/tub did not drain. While we took a shower it filled out to about half full. We called from desk about this problem. It took them a day to have it fixed. Still did not work the best. The balcony was very nice with two chairs and a table. I would have liked to be a little higher up since we looked straight into the apartment complex next door but overall it was very nice and relaxing to sit outside. We had breakfast one day at the hotel. French toast and waffles. Nothing to brag about... average hotel room and a little pricey for what we got. The pool area looked very nice. We spend an hour their one night and had the whole area to ourselves. Parking is 20 dollars per day valet only... if you decide to rent a car which I would do. Taxis are expensive in Miami and nothing is very close to each other. Coconut grove is about a 10 minute walk from the hotel along a major road. Overall coconut walk area is dead except for at night. I was a little disappointed in the shop selection. A lot of empty stores waiting for rent. Overall I would not spend more than two days in this area. The hotel is looking a little worn and dated. Personally their isn't a lot to do and I think their are many other areas of Miami that have much more action.

Reviews.Title: “Very accommodating staff”
Reviews.Author: neo_phyte57
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because it is one of the hotels on the company list (thus has a discounted rate), although I was in Miami on vacation. I was a bit leery after reading the reviews here but ... We checked in very late and the front desk fellow spent a lot of his time to find the right room for us (we wanted one with king bed, high in the hotel, facing the ocean, non-smoking). We checked out a smokers' room but we got one of the handicap rooms which is actually very roomy and nice. The only problem was that there was no shower curtain installed at the time. So very late at night, they dug out a shower curtain and the security guard came to install it. This is a clean, beautiful hotel with a decent (and free) business center. You can avoid the valet parking if you leave before about 10 AM and arrive back at the hotel after about 10 PM, parking at nearby meter street parking. One problem is that the wireless connection in the hotel is weak on higher floors and I couldn't get a company VPN connection. We wished we actually could have enjoyed the hotel more (the pool is gorgeous as is the view of the surroundings) but we were too busy visiting the sites and sounds of Miami. We never felt we had to speak Spanish for better service even though it would have been nice (we are oriental, btw). A terrific stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place just outside downtown Miami”
Reviews.Author: Jarno
Reviews.Content: Okay, this isn't the place to go if you want to spend your vacation hanging around Miami Beach, but it's good if you're doing business downtown or perhaps like to drive a car to some of the sights in and around Miami. The property itself was in tip-top condition and the room was very nice and clean, offering nice views and a large balcony. There is also a decent pool area. The coconut grove area is nice for strolling outside and dining in the evenings. From this hotel there are several nice restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: act1013
Reviews.Content: Stayed during 4th of July week. Front desk staff was pleasant and friendly. Room was clean with a great view of the Grove Marina (could see 4th of July fireworks from my balcony!). This is one of the only few hotels I've stayed at where I didn't hear anyone in the room next door. Valet service is $20/day but there are parking meters on the same street as the hotel (although I don't know what their time limit is). Bathroom towels could be updated (looked worn out and were not soft) and the tub was kinda worn out. Satellite signal went down a couple of times during my stay due to heavy storms. Other than that I had a great vacation at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tip mongers - Service with an attitude”
Reviews.Author: jsholt
Reviews.Content: My family of three stayed at this hotel for 7 days during May. The following are my complaints: 1)Front desk staff ignored our simple requests for wake-up calls. They are cold and impersonal to the friendliest of guests, and the bigger latino guy at the front desk just gives blank stares if you ask him anything. 2)Service is sorely lacking until they know you will tip... and "My pleasure" is their snide and sarcastic response for EVERYTHING. 3)Valet staff is overworked and there is always a line of people waiting to drop-off or pickup their cars. Parking is "Valet Only" so be prepared to fork over 20 bucks/day for it... plus a tip everytime you retrieve your car. 4)This hotel is NOISY - staff and maintenance make noise on guest halls at ALL hours of the night (like slamming doors and we never figured out where the construction noises came from). They also hold very loud parties and private banquet functions which create WAY more noise and traffic than this small old single-tower hotel was built to host!! 5)Maids are very nice, but only give ONE knock before quickly entering guest rooms so lock your deadbolt if you don't want to be walked-in on. **Some more positive things: Our room was a bit small, but it had a great view of Biscayne Bay and the marina. Fresh Market is just across the street. We also got a delicious free buffet breakfast every morning. Coconut Grove and CocoWalk is okay... with cafes and standard suburban shopping mall fare in a dense and historic development... and its a quirky/cool neighborhood. But judging from its surroundings (the closed Playhouse & empty Cocowalk storefronts) - the neighborhood is clearly undergoing some changes for the worse. OVERALL, we would never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay AWAY!!!”
Reviews.Author: emberito
Reviews.Content: After a mediocre stay a few months ago I decided to give this hotel another chance...and another...and another because it was conveniently located to my client. After four stays, I have decided this will be my last one. I outline my reasons below: The primary reason is the horrible hotel management and staff. They have no empathy, lack courtesy, and are abrupt. I am a gold Hilton member, which means at most other hotels I am upgraded and provided with a free breakfast. Not here! The staff seems bothered that you even ask them. One staff member in particular (Aaron) is of special note for his rudeness. Other reasons to stay away include the cracked titles, smelly carpets, small rooms, and bathrooms that are in major need of renovation. If you want a Motel 6 experience at a Hilton price this is the hotel for you. This is the last time I will stay in this hotel and would tell my friends to stay away!!!

Reviews.Title: “Well located hotel for trips out of Miami”
Reviews.Author: tinka14
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the only one available through Premiere Sports Travel as we travelled on a package deal for the final NASCAR race of the season at Homestead, Miami. (we had previously travelled with them to Vegas in March 2006 where there had been a choice of hotels) and as we wanted to stay on in Miami after the race we also booked extra nights at the hotel. The hotel was well located for trips out of Miami....it's only a few minutes up the coast road to the Vizcaya Mansion and gardens (very much worth visiting) and also the Fairchild Tropical Gardens, in the other direction (also well worth visiting) and the hotel is an hour from Homestead and the Everglades National Park. It was also well located for a trip to the Bayside Marketplace, about 20 minutes by car. Coconut Grove itself was pleasant enough but there wouldn't be enough to do for a week here, in the main vicinity itself, the main shopping area, CocoWalk was a 10 minute walk away and there were enough places to eat here for the week, the excellent Cafe TU TU Tango and the Cheesecake Factory. It's also a 20 minute drive to the airport and a further 10 minutes past the airport to the Dolphin Mall (if you can find it, not signposted from the road!!!) we did find it but more luck than anything! The hotel was welcoming as you get a warm cookie when you check in and the breakfast was good (we had the buffet, more for convenience than anything else, as it wasn't too cheap) However, when we got back from the NASCAR race late on the Saturday night, it was a shame that room service was not 24 hr as it would have been great to get something to eat, especially as we had to be up early for the Sunday race the next day. My husband had to chase someone up to get us a drink at the hotel pool bar as no-one seemed interested to serve us or the other people there who were waiting to be served. The room was quite nice and we did get a room on a higher floor with a marina view as requested. The hotel wasn't anything special though and I would say that the Wyndham a few blocks down looked better from the outside anyway. It wasn't a bad hotel just a little disappointing in a few ways.

Reviews.Title: “Great view of the marina”
Reviews.Author: jackieh8
Reviews.Content: I travel quite often to the Miami area and I believe this will be my "regular" hotel. As a diamond member I was given room 1905 which is the top floor. The room is a little weird as the bed is actually a murphy bed. It wouldn't have worked if I had been traveling with my husband, but since I was alone on business it was okay. This floor apparently is generally used for meetings as most of the rooms are conference type rooms. I'm not sure what the views are like for the other rooms, but if you can get one facing the marina it is very nice. I found the staff very helpful, only one issue. After receiving my room service dinner I had completed my request for breakfast, instead of hanging it out on the door I just gave it to the delivery person. My mistake, I did not put my room number on it, but it would have been nice if the person who took checked it for accuracy and completed the information. Needless to say my breakfast did not show up when expected. When I called the problem was explained to me and my breakfast started. All seemed fine, but then I received a call that they were out of grapefruit juice. Hello, I'm in FLORIDA, how can they not have grapefruit juice? Again, I started the initial problem so I don't hold that against the staff, who were all very friendly. The hotel offers free internet connections in the room. If you don't have a wireless connection you can get a bridge from the reception desk. Will stay here again. One other comment, the entrance is a little hard to find. I saw the hotel, but not the entrance and had to do a couple of u-turns.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Christy_J
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Doubletree in Coconut Grove, Florida and it was a great experience! The rooms were very clean and nicely decorated! The service was great from the moment we got there. Oh, and they give you the best warm cookies when you check-in! A very nice touch!

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, unfortunate for my wedding guests!”
Reviews.Author: AlexMBAtlanta_GA
Reviews.Content: My mother went early to scout out hotels in Miami to host our guests over my weekend wedding in April. She was impressed with the cleanliness of the rooms, their overall appearance, and the level of attentiveness with the service. Unfortunately, once the weekend came the level of service changed. This is a compilation of not only what I experienced while I was there, but what my guests experienced as well. For starters, the front desk was very obnoxius, particularly to my brother. The man at the front desk was checking him in, got distracted, and did not give my brother his key or room number. He looked up and asked my brother if he needed anything else, and then proceeded to get in an arguement with him about whether or not he had given him a key. Which was ridiculous, considering my brother was wearing his swim trunks and had nowhere to put a key! I had two friends arrive and head down to the bar for a drink. After requesting a couple of beers, the woman behind the bar informed them that she couldn't serve them because she was off duty. She went to find someone who could tend the bar and came back 20 minutes later. Honestly, how hard is it to sell a beer? A couple who attended our wedding requested a bayview room and did not get one, although they had paid the full price for a bayview. They were not refunded their money. My fiance's brothers wnated to get something out of the car, but since the car was in valet the valet had to go get it. They were not allowed to go to the car at any time to retrieve anything, So they ended up having to get the valet to go to the car multiple times. The valets were very inconvenienced about having to do ther jobs and go retrieve the items. There are two elevators. Neither of them work at any point in time. Pray you are within hiking distance of your room. Our final bill had valet charges of $20 a day for our car. The funny thing is, our car was back home in Atlanta. Please check your bill carefully if you stay here! I had many other complaints but these are the ones that stick out in my memory. Overall, my guests were very unsatisfied with the service. My mother is planning to write and send a formal list of complaints soon, so I request the management not send a pithy reply to this posting saying they were not aware of any problems. You will be aware soon enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: gottogo
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my husband last weekend and was very happy, in particular with the very helpful attitude of the manager and front desk staff. They obviously aim to please. The hotel is an easy walk to Coconut Grove's restaurants and shops and is also very close to the seafront etc. The rooms are fine and overall the hotel is very clean. There is a good buffet breakfast and a huge swimming pool with plenty of seating. I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, good value”
Reviews.Author: TineadsTravels
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Doubletree Hotel in Coconut Grove. This hotel is in a great location and our room had a private balcony overlooking the harbour. The room with a king size bed was very clean and comfortable with the usual extras (iron, coffee maker etc.) We could walk up to Coconut Grove shops and restaurant in 10 minutes. However our great stay was mostly due to the excellent service we received from the staff, especially John Sagam the manager. He even sent cake and wine to our room for my boyfriends birthday - very nice touch. Thank you for making my visit to Miami very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “wow, this turned out well”
Reviews.Author: workplay
Reviews.Content: Well, as they say on this site, I was worried when reading some of the reviews. But I have nothing but good things to say about this hotel. Great staff, location and rooms. We had a one bedroom suite on the 17th floor, great amenities, 2 balconies and great views. A short walk to Coco Walk, restaurants, and a Fresh Market across the street. We had a good meal at the restaurant on site as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I arrived at this "Boutique" hotel, which was very far from the truth! The staff was outstanding and provided awesome customer service. This hotel is currently under construction the hall ways were dirty with and dry wall stuff. The room was okay, just small and so was the bathroom with poor ventilation. Please note that there's isn't a "gift shop" just a 3x5 window with a lock on it, with a few items in it. I had to make trip to the local drug store about 2-3 miles away. This is again a good location for walking around, but not to stay in the room longer then needed. We ordered room service and it was excellent, we had steak, pasta and a bottle of wine, all was yummy! I'm a Silver Honers member they did make me feel welcomed. Since, it was 32 degree and the hotel didn't have heat.

Reviews.Title: “Find another hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PFP
Reviews.Content: Totally worn down hotel which you should avoid if you want to visit pleasant Coconut Grove. My room was overpriced, the corridors and elevators were dirty and the pool area was not much more than a hole in a concrete terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Not really that close to the action”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was excited at the prospect of walking to cool stuff in the Grove, but I ended up driving each time. It just wasn't as close as you might think to the good restaurants and bars. At least 15 (more like 20) minutes. The room was OH SOO small. The reviews below are correct, you will have a hard time fitting into these little spaces. Finally, the maid stole a gift-wrapped present from our luggage. Bear that in mind and keep your valuables out of sight is my advice.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel ...quiet area”
Reviews.Author: dconneely
Reviews.Content: overall a nice place. room was clean and comfortable , staff excellent, had a problem with a fuzzy tv..fixed it within five minutes...pool area: nice with good chairs to sit on in both shaded and sunny areas, front desk pleasant and helpful...only down side is its a very quiet area but only about a 12 min walk to CoCo Walk (( although at night women might not like that walk since it is so quiet )) ... looks like a grocery store going in across the street so a place to buy some water , snacks without paying silly hotel prices in a few weeks, breakfast was very good in the hotel but not sure the price since i got comped for being a hilton honors members, i paided 159 a night for 4 adults in the room and was happy

Reviews.Title: “Don't Pay for Parking”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff pushed hard for the outragously-priced valet parking from the time we pulled up, and offered no suggestions on alternatives. The third contact by a valet parking staff member actually told us to move our car unless we used valet parking as we were unloading our luggage. There is a good parking option a bit over a block away at the public "Shake a Leg" facility. If you exit after hours - parking is free. Otherwise, it is a few bucks (credit cards accepted). Restaurant was a highlight. Above average food quality, excellent staff, and fair price. Room had some noise in the alley from construction trucks that had traveled up the street from a renovation project... not sure why they were there.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place”
Reviews.Author: Hazmatter
Reviews.Content: I didn't have any problems, one of my co-workers complained his room was tiny, but the rest of us each had a decent sized room. Staff was friendly, hotel was clean and safe. It is close to the CoCoWalk tourist shopping area. And you can walk across the street to Scotty's Landing, a little place on the water to get some acceptable burgers / nachos type food and watch boats.

Reviews.Title: “Wow what a small room”
Reviews.Author: FLORIDAGirl1965
Reviews.Content: Boy was i surprised at the corner room size. We are actually stay at Hilton brand hotels all the time and this was an "upgrade". The room is the smallest I have EVER stayed in. Since, I stay in hotels 5 out of 7 days per week, I have alot to compare to. This time I brought my wife. We couldn't move about the room freely. You can't walk around the bed at the same time that someone else is. There was no room to do it. We frequently, had to climb over things to get somewhere. We were always moving our personnals to make room for walking and living There was no room at all for 2 suitcases. The bathroom can't fit two people at the same time or accomadate toileties for 2 people. The balcony was so slender we couldn't sit in the chairs. Really, unimpressive for a Hilton family hotel. In contrast, The view was fabulous and there is a marina across the road to dock at. It is a beautiful area to stroll and absorb the manicured lawns. The pool area had a huge pool and decking area with nothing really exciting. The the pool area overlooks the road with the marina past that. but what made it AWLFUL, was it had a ---- poor bartender that couldn't handle his position. He was supposed to take our order for food for over 40 minutes but was trying to help the drunk instead at the bar. You can't deal with someone that is so intoxicated that they are senseless. The drunk should had been removed altogether either to their room or arrested for legally public intox and disorderly conduct. Yes she was that bad. but they just twidled their thumbs, dum dee dum. We went into the lobby and spoke to the manager about it because the girl was screaming things into her cell phone, like "you mother------". We just had to leave hoping to return later when this little "thing" cleared out. But the drunk was still being loud and abnoxious 2 HOURS later still. Really is ---- poor service and could have been avoided.but mainly should have been avoided. Paris, where is your "drunk as a skunk" policy???? The one great thing was the staff at the curb parking the cars and such they are amazing.... I don't think I will stay there again, as we also, had items of clothing stolen from our room. We were reimbursed for them by price but not for anything more. I give this place a "1" for all the above and it would be a zero except for the great curbside staff.. This hotels motto should be "you stay, you pay......"

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: akupupule
Reviews.Content: We spent last nite here, after a cruise and a trip to Key West. The hotel is down the street and a few minutes walk from "downtown" Coconut Grove. It fronts Biscayne Bay and has nice views from the upper floors of the bay and Key Biscayne, although immediately across the street and btween the hotel and the bay are boat storage facilities, which hampers what could be a nicer view. The staff is extremely nice and helpful and upgraded us to a 10th floor bayview room with balcony at no charge (because of our Hilton Honors?) . The room was average size, with a King bed, but the bathroom was very large, with a tub/ shower, dual sinks and a bidet. The room was clean, and well equiped with a large tv in the amoire, as well as a wet bar on the side of the room. Parking is valet only, but if you call from your room, you vehicle is waiting for you when you reach the lobby. The hotel is very nice and is obviously a favorite of many of the airline flight crews. A downside to our stay was there were bad odors in the hallways (something we have noticed in several hotels in this area).

Reviews.Title: “A Great & Cheaper Alternative for South Beach”
Reviews.Author: dm6410
Reviews.Content: This is a great alternative to staying directly on South Beach. My boyfriend and I stayed here the weekend of 8/27/04-09/01/04 and everything was perfect....Our room was very nice, although small. This is an extremely clean hotel and the staff was very friendly and helpful. We are going to Miami again this year and we are definitely staying at the Doubletree. This a good choice....Good Luck!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms and great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Doubletree for one night in early December 2004. We had 2 adjoining rooms that faced the construction. The construction (about a block away) was not a problem. No noise that I noticed. The rooms were very nice with high-quality furnishings (bed, sofa chairs, tables). Both rooms had patios that were decent. The bathrooms were a bit small. The breakfast was particularly nice. There were biscuits and gravy, some kind of fancy omellete, fruit, potatos, etc. On the slight negative side, it is not a hotel that will impress you much either. The lobby is very small and doesn't have anything fancy. We used the pool, which I felt was on the smaller side. It also was not heated that warm. Still, overall, I was happy with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Staff is great...Toilets are a problem”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff is the only reason this place is still open they are very helpful, and caring towards the guests...Limitations on their services are posed by the inadequate property conditions which are beyond their control. The plumbing is the worst, toilets run, dont flush, tubs get stopped up, the same for the sinks. The hotel is remodeled but the essential elements of the rooms are still unrepaired and outdated. A/C was broken while i stayed here.and the windows were locked and could not be opened. The food is terrible and expensive please explore other dinning options.

HotelInfo.Name: Courtyard Miami Coconut Grove
HotelInfo.Address: 2649 South Bayshore Drive, Miami, FL 33133
